comment: We got sub rogue buffs boys and girls! I don’t know that much about sub as I only stick to assassination. But I was hoping to try and perhaps switch over to sub. With the buffs it got for the November 22 tuning, do you sub rogues think it will be enough to make sub feel like it’s in a good spot?
Not compared to other classes.
All 3 specs will be within range of each other once they also fix the bugs with SecTech.

I pay Bliz to get transmog, other than that are abusive (PVP), boring (PVE) poops.
In arena no matter what I do I can’t kill any healer, you chase them for 5 mins they still jumping like a rabbit. If I get a full eye beam I am dead.
In raids my fellow raiders lie on the floor while I grind bosses with few other people.
By the time I say this I have already canceled my sub. My biggest mistake is buying DF pre-patch .
So for anyone else who comes after:

This is an Outlaw rogue with no EoN offhand and more mastery than crit or haste complaining about doing no damage. This person also complaining about balance during a prepatch. So, don’t let this negativity affect your own opinions, please. Rogues have issues, sure, but not the ones this clown is crying about lol.

It’s probably just me but I’m testing between warrior and rogue which I want to main fully in DF and for some reason rogue just feels off for me in dungeons. I’m assuming I’m the only one who thinks so but thought maybe someone here could tell me why.

Rogue not are particularly know for their AoE and cleave damage. Which is what dungeons are all about. Any DPS is good enough to get through the boss fights. But dungeons focus on how fast you can clear the trash. Which leads to “pull the whole room and hope no one dies” mentality. This, in general, doesn’t favor rogues.
Does this tend to feel better at max for things like m+ where things live longer? Trying to decide between the two classes since I plan on doing m+, raid, and probably PVP (iffy).
My commits apply to max level, 60 at the moment. Level 70 in Dragon Flight might be different because of more choices offered by the talent tree.
In regards to leveling. It’s really not worth worrying about. You just don’t have enough tools to work with until about level 50 or so. Just run dungeons as fast as you can to get gear and level up.
get 5 cps, pop blade furry and unleash high damage moves. AOE damage.
Thats literally all to got to do for trash, but rogues start to shine in the Time to Kill on a boss or a single target elite.

Mostly outlaw perspective, been doing my one 15 for the week for the last 2-3 weeks: I certainly fall off the meters in some trash pulls. That BF target cap feels bad man. Especially if there’s a havoc in the group, or one of those rare ret pallies that just runs proc bingo (how can you not love ret aoe). But then we get to the boss and I can contribute ute some proper burst.
Conversely, been struggling on my fury warrior, doing much lower content (sub 10s) who knows, maybe im just bad.
(post deleted by author)

It’s really not that bad. With subterfuge and or the garrote talent, you can get up 4 garrotes out of stealth, or 2 and a rupture. It’s all about time management. Quickly figuring out and gauging how many dots you really need to have up to maintain energy.
Rupture refilling energy on death is key. Garrote is the biggest damage.
In a normal trash pack of 4-5 enemies I’ll often

garrote, tab, garrote, rupture, fok, fok, rupture, MFD, rupture, (keep working on filling in energy) and at a certain point based on how fast they are dropping you might just decide to stop applying garrotes and ruptures and go for more FoK, CT, and envenoms to fish for a bomb.

Hello fellow Stealth lovers, as the title states I’m brand new to Rogue just hit 60. For those of you who haven’t played Rogue for a long time, what was the hardest thing for you to figure out while playing Rogue. Was it learning to track your timers, figuring out when to Reroll RTB, Learning the rotation. You seasoned Rogue players can chime in as well!
Haven’t played a long time, or have played a long time? I’m confused by the spirit of the post.
My take is that no matter how long you played a class, there are a lot of small changes that end up shifting the way it interacts with some parts.

The biggest thing I have learned to do is stop listening to other players and guides and just try to enjoy what I can. If something like Roll The Bones takes away from the feel of a spec, I wouldn’t use it. Take it off my bar. Or deprioritize it enough that in the off chance I did click it, I no longer felt the “chore” in using it.

Is anyone else getting these combo point bugs?
The combo points shows in the HUD are different than my character portrait.
Combo points drop off or disappear on pvp and pve targets when I swap for CC or w/e.
When I use the 6th combo point ability the combo points bar will stay filled other than the first point bubble.
I have noticed this with multiple specs (mostly outlaw and assassin), and they all show up regardless of the addons I have installed / active.
Safe to say these are going to get worked out, or is there a new setting or something I am missing here?
You’d think someone with 27,000 ach points would know what a forum search is…

Sorry I don’t live on the forums like some people I guess. I did search and the first few topics were all from years ago. If it wasn’t in the last 2 weeks I ignored it and then they only mentioned pvp issues. I did not see a mention of the other HUD problems other than in UI and addon issues.
Yeah I noticed the bug too.
I noticed this issue but it was a WA that was bugging it. May try to see if it’s one of your Auras.
UnitPower(“player”, Enum.PowerType.ComboPoints) is still working fine for me in my custom UI, so the problem lies with Blizzard’s UI code.

I’ve been trying to use blizz ui but my combo points aren’t working on longer fights on finishing moves I sit there n pound envenom and nothing so I press all buttons til it works again. Then the combo points start going from right to left til I reload.
I guess Blizzard is just going to ignore this in the hopes that it goes away or we use addons over it.

I love how combo points show up so agonizingly slow on the blizzard ui. When you use an ability, you may or may not have enough time to realize you just procced 4 extra combo points and now you are capped before the global cd is over.

Have to spend 20 points to get to the third to last level of assassination.
Poison bomb is 2
Dashing Scoundrel is 3
no more points to put into dragon tempered blades.
The equivalent on the others sides:
Tiny toxic blade 1
Zoldyck Rage 3
gives kingsbane 1
and to the right
shrouded suffocation or sepsis/serated bone spike 1
scent of blood 3
then
Indiscriminate Carnage 1

Is there something customer support can help with here? If you think you don’t have enough points, remember you will level to 70 in Dragon Flight and get more skill points. If you think there’s a bug, you’ll want to report it in game or in the bug report forum.

I’ll tack on to what Jeys suggested and also suggest the Rogue forum. Posting here, there isn’t anything anyone can do. This forum is one for players to assist other players. It is not a contact point for the Devs, and Devs are the ones who make the design choices. But the Devs do collect data from Bug Reports, the class forums and pretty much any other forum but for this one.
It was designed that way on purpose.
Frustrating but it is what it is.
Yup.

You can get (by level 70) both Kingsbane and Indiscriminate Carnage, but if you want Dragon Tempered Blades, it’s the only final tier talent you can get. Because… I don’t know, Blizzard decided that Poison Bomb definitely needed 2 ranks for some odd reason.
That IS rather depressing.
Ok, I agree. I’m not sure how many other classes/specs have a final tier/capstone point disparity like that.
So, using the Wowhead talent builder for Dragonflight, I learned something interesting.
Every other class and spec has multiple combinations of capstone abilities that they can get by level 70.
For example, Arms Warriors have 5 capstone abilities, and can potentially get any 4 of them. (I make no claims as to whether that would be an effective build or not.)

But Assassination Rogues are, at least to my cursory examination, the only class and spec where if we take a specific capstone ability, in this case, Dragon Tempered Blades, it locks us out of any other capstone ability.

Even Beast Mastery Hunters, with the Dire Pack capstone ability costing 6 of their last 10 spec talent points (and thus comparable to Dragon Tempered Blades, which also costs 6 of our last 10 talent spec points), can still pick up one other capstone ability, due to the talent point cost of getting to them either being 2 or 3 talent points.

Now, perhaps that’s for some sort of balance reason, where having, say Kingsbane and Dragon Tempered Blades would be completely broken. (And given how Kingsbane works, that’s entirely possible that is the reason why.)
It is a balance reason that is why.
You’ll have to forgive me, I went to Icy veigns and still seem to be doing poor DPS compared to other Rogues with gear like mine.

I train on the dummies and notice a jump in my DPS when I’m altering Sinister Strike with my pistol shot, I used to only use pistol shot when it gets highlighted on my toolbar and it was doing less dps than if I go 1 and 1. I also seem to generate more CP when I do it that way as well.
I’m also using my vanishes and doing Ambush yet my dps is only like 10k when I’m seeing others doing like 14k-23k. I’m blowing all my cooldowns with AR, SnD, etc.
Not sure if it has been mentioned here yet. The next tuning update shows the subtlety specialization getting buffed.
Notable mentions are shadowstrike’s damage being increased by 10% and shadow blades cooldown being reduced to 2 min, down from 3 min.
soo. danse macabre down to 6 percent, from 10.
it wasnt really that great of a talent at 10 percent… especially since it doesnt stack into the 2nd shadowdance… and its actually better for dmg to spam shadowstrike. talent is terrible.
It actually doesn’t reset now and still stacks with every new ability. It’s very good for burst in dance. It’d be nice if it lasted a bit longer after dance ended, but I still think it’s decent.
With DF about 2 weeks away, how are our three specs stacking up to each other?
As I level, I would like to focus on 1 spec so I can be ready for raiding when I hit 70. I prefer Assassination but I’m open to any of them if the performance gap is big enough.
any thoughts or opinions?
I personally will be maining assassination but I hear the Outlaw will be good for Mythic +. Honestly just play whatever fits your playstyle, you can always switch if one gets buffed or nerfed.
Blizzard doesn’t usually let things fly too far out of control for too long. The ol’ 'Fun Detected’™ meme.
Play what tickles your fantasy. Or whatever.
I really enjoy with Assassination loading up DoTs and watching mobs walk towards me and fall over from the rot. Grossly satisfying. Rotation-wise, Outlaw probably the best group content feeling.

Personally, I’m going Sub (contrary to what I anticipated earlier before testing). Secret Technique doesn’t register on damage meters but does full damage, so I want to make it look like I’m a terrible player – but any group I’m in wonders why things are dying quickly still.
I just want to get something clarified, I’m not sure if I’m just missing it or doing it wrong.

It seems to me that Shadowmeld → Stealth works in PvP, but not in PvE. Is that the distinction? Im pretty disappointed it doesn’t seem to work in all content, since it can open up some interesting options.
I was under the impression it got changed so that it didn’t work like that in PvP anymore?
God, if it does I’m going to feel like an idiot for taking my Sub Rogue Draenei instead of Night Elf.

Party members being in combat has always been a problem. Could be a timing thing, I am not sure. But, you’ll notice even if you are standing around, your party getting put in combat will sometimes(generally) put you in combat.

I don’t know maybe it’s just me and I’ve done something incorrect but pretty sure every spec of other classes and this one can reach the bottom tier talent except this one. As of the point of posting this (pre dragon flight) you cannot get the Dragon-Tempered blades talent you are off by 1 point. Why is this the only talent unreachable at current standing is it just that powerful they don’t want you to have it pre DF or am i legit missing something?
Would be nice if it took one less point to get it. Thered be cool synergies
It is designed on that way on purpose due to balance reasoning. Unfortunate.
And to add to this. At max level, you also will not be able to take Dragon Tempered Blades along with either of the other two capstone talents.
Same. I thought I was doing something wrong. Maybe with conduits and other SL stuff it can be OP.
I like the kingsbane and execute dots build, but i hope DTB is as good in PvP. This has been one of the most exciting talents new for DF. Really wanted to try it out. Oh well. A few more weeks.
DTB might just be. It synergizes with many talents.

This doubles the value of every talent that effects poisons. Venomous wounds, improved poisons, Fatal concoction, Dashing scoundrel, twist the knife. It also buffs some others just not as much like Zoldyck recipe, Improved shiv.
It gives a 4% buff to all dmg because of Lethal Dose.
And it gives deadly poison in PVP which is probably like 10% dmg increase.
So the talent alone probably gives like 20% extra dmg in value. Its that strong. It probably just depends on strong Kingbane and Serrated bones spike/sepsis are in comparison.
The current meta DTB build after the 11/11 buffs doesn’t take most poison-related talents. Skips Vicious Venoms, TTK, and TTB.
Also hilariously all builds take the Flying Daggers talent because the extra point not being wasted on the 2nd rank of Vicious Venoms allows it to go into a better 1-pointer.
Can you share the builds
There is no build at the moment. At level 60 we don’t have enough talent points to pick up DTB.
You refer to this as a “meta” build. What is your source?
Not taking 5 stack wound in pvp seems bad eh.
Lmfao aint no way this is whats being passed around as the meta build. Ill be back after trying it…

To preface this, I am not a die hard rogue main. I do think it is what I want to main come DF and I have mained it in past expansions. With the addition to shadow dance in the class tree allowing all 3 specs to utilize it, sub just seems to have lost its identity to me. The thing that gave it a unique flavor. I am wondering if anyone else agrees?

To me the most fun I have ever had playing this game was as a sub rogue in Legion using death from above; allowing us to funnel all of our aoe damage into priority damage. it felt dynamic and potent. And I would be lying if I said I didnt feel like a bamf while doing it.
While we still have shadowdance and ultimately not much has changed, sub just does not seem to have any unique flare anymore. I still enjoy playing it tbh. But just makes me sadge a little.
Edited for typo
well sub rogue lost DFA in BFA and shuriken combo after s1 bfa. So you’re abit late on this.
i wish ShadowDance had stayed sub only.

Yes I understand that. Mentioning DfA was more along the lines of something I wish they would bring back to add some unique flavor back to the sub specialization. But ultimately if you read the post it’s about losing shadow dance as a uniquely sub tool. Thanks for your comment.

Realistically I started this thread to open up discussion as to where the rogue community at large would like to see the identity go. What ideas there may be to give the spec something of its own in terms of playstyle altering mechanics. Or if people whole heartily disagree with my view of the situation. Please change my mind. Explain why and what is giving sub a unique identity.

Yah, I completely agree. I don’t know where it could really go. At this point, the only thing making it unique is shadow magic. Which, I am not a huge fan of. I do like the idea of using magic. But, not offensively. Dealing shadow damage is weird.

I have very conflicted feelings on Shadow Dance being in the class tree. On one hand, Shadow Dance is such a powerful ability, it could be argued the other specs will never compare in PVP to Subtlety without it. On the other hand, it’s just such a core Subtlety ability. Subtlety is suppose to be the “Stealth” spec.
It also really bugs me that nothing huge from the other specs was shared. I mean, Assassination didn’t have anything super cool, I suppose. But, why the heck isn’t Adrenaline Rush in the class tree? I mean, who the heck wanted Thistle Tea and Echoing Reprimand to not only be in the class tree, but be capstone talents!? Sorry, bit off topic…
Sub rogue lost its identity when Hemo was removed. And then again in Legion too.
Kinda late to the party.
Sub lost the bleed identity in Legion when Sin stole Garrote and then lost the Shadow Dance identity in DF. It really feels like you didn’t choose a spec when you choose to play Sub now.
IMO, Sin should only have poisons, and Sub should be the bleed master. Oh, and get rid of Shadow Dance from the class tree.
Especially the absolute comedy legend who made it is literally impossible to get one of the capstone talents at level 60 for assassination?

I don’t have enough words to say how bad this talent is, it was fine being a consumable, but for it’s important talent position in the tree it is just bad, no one wants to press a button every minute to be able to play, but that seems the way you are going by the recent nerfs to energy regeneration. You want to make our gameplay feel worse just to push this boring capstone.
Rogues are not a wind-up toy to have to be wound-up every minute by a button press to be able to play.
Imagine Conjure Water being in the same place for Mages (I will be checking if it is, because I don’t doubt anymore).

all the capstones suck, unless you play sub and want your 2nd dance. but even that was a terrible place to put it.
the capstones are a huge disappointment.

I think the 3 charge thistle tea sucks as a capstone. But I actually enjoy it on beta as Sin. That with marked for death lets you set up for some nice burst. But it sucks as a capstone and should just be a talent node somewhere in the tree.
I think Thistle Tea is fun to use but by no mean should be a cap stone.
My thoughts as well.

Or alternatively, pick a different talent and those who do enjoy it can scoop it up. I’m no assassination kid but thistle was pretty nice on ptr to get 3 charges and crank the crap out of something. Feels similar to a nice adrenaline rush effect in a way and the 13% mastery def made windows during shiv crank the crap out of stuff with kingsbane active and other stuff.
Remove “Thief’s Versatility” put Thistle Tea in it’s place and in place of where Thistle Tea was, put in Flagellation. Done. EZ clap.
Has anyone officially said anything about why Sprint no longer grants water walking at higher levels? It was hard enough losing Soulshape’s speed buff, but now I feel even slower!
Unfortunately I think because of the DF crunch that it has been overlooked. Which is a shame because it was a nice flavorful touch for Sub Rogue.
Blade flurry doing significantly less damage in uldaman that even the tooltip says. Average auto attack in 1 dungeon was 721. Average BF hit was 158. Doesn’t quite add up. (Average dispatch was 6.8k)

Can confirm, I am doing even less overall damage doing aoe in Uldaman than single target, most of the time in aoe fights blade flurry doesn’t even show up in the top 5 on details while in any other dungeon or even target dummies it is number 1 every single time on aoe.

Howdy All!
Recently I leveled up an awesome Pandaren Outlaw Rogue (Sawblades on Azgalor). And I LOVE em. Leveled him up almost exclusively through Battlegrounds. It’s just so fun stealthing around with his swords, firing off pistol shots and being an all around menace and nightmare to people. Was curious though, is there a good go-to source for PvP pointers as a Rogue? A good source for suggested PvP Talent builds? With the new Dragonflight talent trees, there’s a lot of choice in them and I want to be sure not to fall into to many “traps”. Any help is greatly appreciated.
Probably won’t be much until a couple weeks into the new expansion. Its still just pre-patch right now. So people are just figuring stuff out if they are even playing yet.
I haven’t played but I hear good surv but no burst. Your role will be running around map and annoy people until they rage quit.
stayed the same as is, except the cooldown was reduced. 45-1 minute cd. thoughts?
Killing spree can use a rework, something like

Now Changed to finisher, 2min cd, teleport to an enemy, quickly attack with 5 dispatch over 2 seconds. Strength of dispatch depends on combo points used, can blade flurry. Dispatchs cast this way interacts with restless blades at reduced effectiveness

I like killing spree and don’t want it changed to much. either add the cc immunity back or lower the cool down. I am open minded though and I have to ask about your suggestion. 5 dispatch? like 5 of them or a 5 cp dispatch?
yes. For example if you use killing spree at 6 combo points, you will cast 5 dispatches all at 6 cp strength, over 2 seconds.
I played around a little bit with Killing Spree with MA leggo… and even with the guaranteed crits it just was OK. Still preferred Blade Rush.
That means they should at least DOUBLE the damage profile of it. Honestly should probably be like 3x or something, especially if they expect ANYONE to take it over Dreadblades.
Does the garrote buff change anything? I love love assassins current play style. Are is it still way below outlaw?
Viable? Yes

But you won’t keep up with outlaw in M+. The damage to trash outlaw does is just a league above. You can beat them on ST, but not by a whole lot. They are still quite good in PvP though. So kinda depends on what you wanna do with them.

The current iteration of Deathmark feels pretty bad to press. If you are playing improved garrote, you are forced to use Deathmark as an opener in order to double 50% garrote. You also have to reapply bleeds to make deathmark of any benifit. That and deathmark itself does very pitiful damage.

I suggest that Deathmark refresh current bleeds and poisons on the target (minus Kingsbane, as that would be pretty broken) and then duplicate them along with its current effects of copying new bleeds you apply. That way you can use Deathmark as a burst button as it was intended.
Agreed. Its almost like that talent was rushed in
Yeah it feels clunky to press, did they say why vendetta had to get reworked?
Seems fine to me. Vanish lines up so you always have a full Garrote Rupture to apply. With improved Garrote, you can Ambush Garrote for more CPs in openers.

There is a bit of clunky interaction with Exsanguination. If you Exsang Pre-Deathmark it seems to not keep the Exsang buff, but if you use it afterwards the normal bleed and the cloned bleeds all benefit.
I’m just mad they got rid of vendetta and forgot we pretty much all use the vendetta legendary and are now screwed for the remainder of the patch.
Yeah, well, the set bonuses are inactive, so…
That’s completely irrelevant to the issue I’m talking about.
Duskwalker’s patch leggo also doesn’t seem to be working with Deathmark.
Here’s how I’ve been using Deathmark

Build CP to Max-1 (5 with Deeper Strat)
Deathmark > Vanish > Garotte > Rupture
Edit: Changed to proper sequence. Deathmark does break stealth so it should be cast before Vanish.
Rupture and Garotte will last the full duration of Deathmark - 16 seconds. You shouldn’t have to worry about refreshing either.
you have to use deathmark before you apply bleeds. It specifically says bleeds applied after the buff are duplicated.
Getting rid of vendetta was such a mistake and a nerf.
If you do not Deathmark first, you don’t get the duplicated bleeds so you have been wasting DM.
it does duplicate the bleeds, but only Garrote and Rupture. But you sure don’t want to use DM after applying the bleeds because you are losing uptime doing so.
… yes you do. Applying bleeds beforehand is literally a nonissue and the best way to perform the opener without starving yourself.
On a side note its amazing how half this thread is full of people commenting without even understanding the ability.

Its a button that increases our normal attack speed. Woo. How fun. At least make it unique to each spec…like…Assassinations turns into, idk, Poison Maggot. It attaches itself to your target for X seconds based on how many combo points you spend on it, leeches the instant poison damage on your target and stores it until the countdown ends and explodes in an AoE. Increased damage to your main target yada yada yada. idk its SOMETHING at least.
Lets workshop this so we can be ignored by blizzard.
I dont even want it changed to have additional effects. Just removed or made a simple passive. Spending CP on attack speed is stupid.
Yeah Slice and Dice is stupid. It should be a passive effect at like level 28 that increases at level 40 or something.
Finishing moves invigorate you with haste, granting 30%(50% at Rank 2) increased attack speed for 3 seconds per combo point.
You’re welcome Blizzard, I fixed it.
I like it being tacked onto finishing moves or, if removed, getting that animation as a toy or glyph like swirly ball – i’m a sucker for animation nostalgia :0
This keeps coming up, don’t use it then. A lot of us rogues enjoy what it brings when you think deeper about it than spending combo points on a hasty buff.

It increases energy regen by 15% passively when activated (needed) , it increases attempts at getting trinkets to proc on say flayed wing toxin, weapon enchant procs, it further increases shadow techniques proc time, increases chance for the Outlaw kids to get off hand strikes and secondary strikes with their mastery and further increases the value of that 75% proc to get 10 energy for them, increases poison procs for those who are Assassination and affects energy regeneration even further, increases auto attack damage by a considerable amount as well.

Take it off your bars instead of saying this nonsense, they won’t give us a new ridiculous finisher and they aren’t bringing real recuperate back. Any Rogue who loves roguing can appreciate the benefits that this small thing brings. It is a very valuable, if you have deeper strategem - you rarely think about it as is because it gives close to a minute long buff.

Yeah, the subject keep comming back.
I agree Blizz instead of perma removing it, could give an alternative for all spec, not only Sub… Oh, wait, it’s actually what Blizz did! Sin have SnD refreshed after CP finisher, Outlaw have 1 hour of its duration, so he/she forget SnD exist, and Sub got it automatically at the beggining of every fight thx to Premeditation!
And look! With the new talent system you are not forced to choose between Prem and other viable abilities, because it cost only 1 talent point on a huge tree of points!
With all that in mind, the fans of the classic WoW abilities still can use it, and the game is fun for them too, not only for players don’t like SnD!
If that isn’t cool, I don’t know what is.
I disagree in the case of outlaw. That spec is already fast paced and adding another maintenance buff is un-fun.
I actually like SnD for assassin though.

Totally agree Outlaw has now a shi…load of (not all fun) abilities needed to be pressed, not like it was earlier. One of the reasons I stop to play this spec tbh.
One of that kind of ability is Between the Eyes - so cool, thematic and satisfied after pressing it in Legion, now reduce to some crit buff.
SnD as an active ability is not fun or exciting. It makes way more sense to have it as a passive.
I mean I think SnD should be a passive, not gotten rid of.

I play Assassination so SnD is press once at the beginning of the fight and maintain it by envenoming. It was an important ability back in Vanilla but were at the point where it really should just be a passive that occurs once we use a combo spender attacks and combo points spenders add to its duration.

It’s up to the Outlaw to decide if they want to use it then. Easy decision there for them . Us rogues adapt from moment to moment, maybe you want to hold a few seconds as a wave of bads are coming up , maybe we have a priority enemy to nuke, maybe a fresh SnD is useful here to get some life back (if you have recuperate) and just rolled that buff for leech (can’t remember as I am not an outlaw rogue). The point is having tools to use instead of pruning us. They make it passive then they would nerf it down the road because of some dumb streamer abusing it. It’s all up to us to decide when to use something appropriately.
No. Slice and Dice is a great addition to all 3 specs and it sorely needed to return.
Hi,
These are some the major bugs I’ve noticed since pre-patch:

Serrated Bone spike DOT (covenant ability from being necrolord, NOT the talent itself) disappears after 2-3 seconds on a target (tested on multiple mobs in Revendereth). The spike itself hits, but the debuff dot literally goes away by itself after a few seconds. Completely useless ability this way.

Duskwalker’s Patch legendary does NOT reduce Deathmark cooldown (tooltip still says Vendetta) but supposedly all the guides said it does reduce Deathmark cd, but I just tested on Turnip in ORIBOS (yes I made sure I was in SL) and timed Deathmark on my iphone, took entire 2 mins to refresh its CD while I was spamming abilities on dummy). Essentially a completely usless legendary.
Combo points appear and then disappear on targets many times in Battlegrounds. I’ll build like 4 cp’s on a target and without using a finisher at all, will reduce to 1-2 cps. very buggy.
I’m sure there’s more, but these are what I encountered. Hopefully they fix these asap…
bahh meant to post this on my other Rogue.
Grappling Hook for sure is bugged right now when subterfuge is selected. It is 100% causing lost of stealth on PTR, live and beta as far as I can tell.
Can confirm these issues
Also can confirm the leggo is broken… I have swapped to the zoidlocks on my rogues, sucks that I had to do that, but not cool to kill our leggo.
Can confirm that the combo points are not showing correctly on enemy name plate or health bars. Will often show full combo points when I have 0 and vice versa in PVE
this is pretty important to fix imo.
Cp bug happening to durids, too
rushed set up increases the energy cost of all the abilities it affects 20%.
Is it just me, or is Touch of teh Grave constantly breaking stealth now?
my poisons drop when changing realms, not a huge deal but annoying
Leaching poison does not stay on when you log off and log back in. Have to re-apply lethal and non lethal poisons.
I’ve had grappling hook just fail to move me at all. I’ll be attacking the dummies and hook away and not move. It doesn’t happen all of the time but has enough that I’ve noticed it.
[SOLVED] It’s showing up because Options > Combat > Scrolling Combat Text for Self was ticked

It’s not a big deal but I would like not to get the text “Blindside” to show up on my screen when it procs. I have the opacity of spell alerts turned to 0% but that doesn’t seem to impact this. Have tested with all addons disabled and it still shows up.
Thanks for any helpful advice

I’ve always played the “rogue” type in MMO’s. FF14, ESO, Black Desert, SWtor, etc.
I gravitate to the quick, stealthy assassin types for they’re flexibility between pvp, pve, and solo content.
And in WoW, despite all of the rogue’s ups and downs I feel like Rogues have historically been the class with the -least- amount of spikes in outright unviability. Don’t get me wrong, there are times when Rogue has felt like it’s been in the gutter but since Vanilla I think in the history of Blizzard’s pursuit of balance, Rogue’s toolkit keeps it afloat. If we’re not topping meters we will be soon. If we’re not in every arena comp or RBG give it a patch or gear cycle.

Overall outlaw is best for pvp. That being said a good sub rogue will beat a good outlaw any day of the week. So how can outlaw be the best when in 1v1 a sub will beat it? Well we arent talking about duels.

This game is strictly based around 3v3 arena. Outlaw is tankier has double blind… good sustain dps that allows for more “goes” in 3v3. Sub kyrian is good but the nerf to evisc and high skill cap makes it hard unless you have good hand eye coordination have lot of keybinds and dont leave gaps in your cc. Sub rogue sets up the kill shot for a mage while a good priest heals. Thats your 3v3…

You want a great damage and lot easier playstyle? Go assa necro… the flesh craft makes you tanky, the bleeds on your serrrated bone strikes are killer and there dots are strong. You can drop bleeds and poissens and keep up pressure. New to rogue? want to do strong damage that if properly chained togather can kill good warriors locks dks… go assa necro. but you will struggle against hunters and mages esp at higher level and esp 1v1.

outlaw in 3v3 you just pve and wear them them down
sub kyrain you set up fights for ur mage to kill… a good sub rogue can beat almost any class in the game 1v1. not the case in 2v2.
